sceneGraph.math.doubleV

Class SGVec_3d

  • java.lang.Object
    • sceneGraph.math.doubleV.SGVec_3d
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    CanLoad, java.io.Serializable, Vec3d<SGVec_3d>, Vecd<SGVec_3d>, Vec<SGVec_3d>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    IKVector

    public class SGVec_3d
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable, Vec3d<SGVec_3d>, CanLoad
    Encapsulates a 3D vector. Allows chaining operations by returning a reference to itself in all modification methods.
    Author:
    badlogicgames@gmail.com
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      Multiplies this vector by the transpose of the first three columns of the matrix.
      SGVec_3d untransform(Matrix4d matrix)
      Translates this vector in the direction opposite to the translation of the matrix and the multiplies this vector by the transpose of the first three columns of the matrix.

      • magSq

        public double magSq()
        Description copied from interface: Vecd
        This method is faster than Vecd.mag() because it avoids calculating a square root. It is useful for comparisons, but not for getting exact lengths, as the return value is the square of the actual length.
        Specified by:
        magSq in interface Vecd<SGVec_3d>
        Returns:
        The squared euclidean length

      • distSq

        public double distSq(SGVec_3d point)
        Description copied from interface: Vecd
        This method is faster than Vecd.dist(Vecd) because it avoids calculating a square root. It is useful for comparisons, but not for getting accurate distances, as the return value is the square of the actual distance.
        Specified by:
        distSq in interface Vecd<SGVec_3d>
        Parameters:
        point - The other vector
        Returns:

      • mul4x3

        public SGVec_3d mul4x3(double[] matrix)
        Left-multiplies the vector by the given 4x3 column major matrix. The matrix should be composed by a 3x3 matrix representing rotation and scale plus a 1x3 matrix representing the translation.
        Parameters:
        matrix - The matrix
        Returns:
        This vector for chaining

      • prj

        public SGVec_3d prj(Matrix4d matrix)
        Multiplies this vector by the given matrix dividing by w, assuming the fourth (w) component of the vector is 1. This is mostly used to project/unproject vectors via a perspective projection matrix.
        Parameters:
        matrix - The matrix.
        Returns:
        This vector for chaining

      • getPlaneProjectionOf

                                     SGVec_3d p2)

        Parameters:
        p1 - vector representing first edge of plane
        p2 - vector representing second edge of plane
        Returns:

        Parameters:
        norm -
        Returns:

      • rot

        public SGVec_3d rot(Matrix4d matrix)
        Multiplies this vector by the first three columns of the matrix, essentially only applying rotation and scaling.
        Parameters:
        matrix - The matrix
        Returns:
        This vector for chaining

      • unrotate

        public SGVec_3d unrotate(Matrix4d matrix)
        Multiplies this vector by the transpose of the first three columns of the matrix. Note: only works for translation and rotation, does not work for scaling. For those, use rot(Matrix4d) with Matrix4d.inv().
        Parameters:
        matrix - The transformation matrix
        Returns:
        The vector for chaining

      • untransform

        public SGVec_3d untransform(Matrix4d matrix)
        Translates this vector in the direction opposite to the translation of the matrix and the multiplies this vector by the transpose of the first three columns of the matrix. Note: only works for translation and rotation, does not work for scaling. For those, use mul(Matrix4d) with Matrix4d.inv().
        Parameters:
        matrix - The transformation matrix
        Returns:
        The vector for chaining
